pli-tv-kd9:0.3: The chapter on those from Campā
pli-tv-kd9:0.4: The account of the monk Kassapagotta
pli-tv-kd9:1.1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Campā on the banks of the Gaggarā lotus pond.
pli-tv-kd9:1.1.2: At that time in the country of Kāsī there was a village called Vāsabha.
pli-tv-kd9:1.1.3: The resident monk there, Kassapagotta, was dedicated to it,
pli-tv-kd9:1.1.4: trying to get good monks to come, to make those who had come be at ease, and to make the local monastery grow and reach maturity.
pli-tv-kd9:1.1.5: At this time a number of monks who were wandering in Kāsī arrived at Vāsabha.
pli-tv-kd9:1.1.6: When Kassapagotta saw those monks coming, he prepared seats, and he set out a foot-stool, a foot-scraper, and water for washing the feet. He then went out to meet them, received their bowls and robes, and asked if they wanted water to drink. He helped them get a bath and also with rice-porridge, non-staple foods, and meals.
pli-tv-kd9:1.1.8: “He’s great this resident monk, in that he helps us with all these things.
pli-tv-kd9:1.1.9: Let’s settle down right here in Vāsabha.”
pli-tv-kd9:1.2.2: “These monks are now rid of their tiredness from traveling.
pli-tv-kd9:1.2.3: And by now they know where to get alms.
pli-tv-kd9:1.2.4: Moreover, it’s hard work to seek support from other families all one’s life, and people don’t like to be asked.
pli-tv-kd9:1.2.5: Let me stop helping them with rice-porridge, non-staple foods, and meals.”
pli-tv-kd9:1.2.8: “Previously this resident monk helped us get a bath and also with rice-porridge, non-staple food, and meals.
pli-tv-kd9:1.2.9: But he has stopped helping us with food.
pli-tv-kd9:1.3.1: Soon afterwards those newly arrived monks assembled and confronted Kassapagotta about what had happened, adding,
pli-tv-kd9:1.3.6: “No. I haven’t committed any offense that I should recognize.”
pli-tv-kd9:1.3.7: Those newly arrived monks then ejected Kassapagotta for not recognizing an offense.
pli-tv-kd9:1.3.9: “I don’t actually know whether this was an offense or not, whether I’ve committed one or not, whether I’ve been ejected or not, whether it was legitimate or not, whether it’s reversible or not, whether it’s fit to stand or not.
pli-tv-kd9:1.3.10: Let me go to Campā and ask the Buddha about this.”
pli-tv-kd9:1.4.1: He then put his dwelling in order, took his bowl and robe, and set out for Campā.
pli-tv-kd9:1.4.2: When he eventually arrived, he went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.
pli-tv-kd9:1.4.3: Since it is the custom for Buddhas to greet newly arrived monks,
pli-tv-kd9:1.4.5: “I hope you are keeping well, monk, I hope you’re comfortable;
pli-tv-kd9:1.4.6: I hope you’re not tired from traveling.
pli-tv-kd9:1.4.7: And where have you come from?”
pli-tv-kd9:1.4.8: “I’m keeping well, Venerable Sir, I’m comfortable,
pli-tv-kd9:1.4.9: and I’m not tired from traveling.”
pli-tv-kd9:1.5.1: And he told the Buddha all that had happened, adding,
pli-tv-kd9:1.6.4: You have been ejected by an illegitimate legal procedure that’s reversible and unfit to stand.
pli-tv-kd9:1.6.5: Go back and stay right there in the village of Vāsabha.”
pli-tv-kd9:1.6.6: “Yes, Sir.” He got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and set out for Vāsabha.
pli-tv-kd9:1.7.1: Soon those newly arrived monks became anxious and remorseful:
pli-tv-kd9:1.7.3: that we have ejected, without reason, a pure monk who hadn’t committed any offense.
pli-tv-kd9:1.7.4: Well then, let’s go to Campā and confess our offense in the presence of the Buddha.”
pli-tv-kd9:1.7.5: They then put their dwellings in order, took their bowls and robes, and set out for Campā.
pli-tv-kd9:1.7.6: When they eventually arrived, they went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.
pli-tv-kd9:1.7.7: Since it is the custom for Buddhas to greet newly arrived monks,
pli-tv-kd9:1.7.9: “I hope you are keeping well, monks, I hope you’re comfortable;
pli-tv-kd9:1.7.10: I hope you’re not tired from traveling.
pli-tv-kd9:1.7.11: And where have you come from?”
pli-tv-kd9:1.7.12: “We are keeping well, Venerable Sir, we’re comfortable,
pli-tv-kd9:1.7.13: and we’re not tired from traveling.
pli-tv-kd9:1.7.14: There’s a village in the country of Kāsī called Vāsabha,
pli-tv-kd9:1.7.15: and that’s where we come from.”
pli-tv-kd9:1.8.1: “Are you the ones who ejected the resident monk?”
pli-tv-kd9:1.8.6: “Foolish men, it’s not suitable, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of an ascetic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:1.8.7: How can you, without reason, eject a pure monk who had not committed any offense?
pli-tv-kd9:1.8.8: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …” …
pli-tv-kd9:1.8.9: and after rebuking them … he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-kd9:1.8.10: “You should not, without reason, eject a pure monk who hasn’t committed any offense.
pli-tv-kd9:1.8.11: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-kd9:1.9.1: Those monks then got up from their seats, put their upper robe over one shoulder, bowed down with their heads at the Buddha’s feet, and said,
pli-tv-kd9:1.9.2: “Venerable Sir, we have committed an offense. Foolishly, deludedly, and unskillfully we acted like this.
pli-tv-kd9:1.9.3: Please accept our confession for our future restraint.”
pli-tv-kd9:1.9.4: “Certainly you have committed an offense. Foolishly, deludedly, and unskillfully you acted like this.
pli-tv-kd9:1.9.5: But since you acknowledge your offense and you make amends for it in accordance with the Teaching, I accept your confession.
pli-tv-kd9:1.9.6: For this is called growth in the training of the noble ones: acknowledging an offense, making amends in accordance with the Teaching, and undertaking restraint for the future.”
pli-tv-kd9:1.9.7: Discussion of illegitimate legal procedures done by a divided assembly, etc.
pli-tv-kd9:2.1.1: At that time the monks at Campā did legal procedures such as these:
pli-tv-kd9:2.1.2: illegitimate legal procedures done by a divided assembly, illegitimate legal procedures done unanimously,
pli-tv-kd9:2.1.3: legitimate legal procedures done by a divided assembly, legitimate-like legal procedures done by a divided assembly,
pli-tv-kd9:2.1.5: one person ejecting another, one ejecting two, one ejecting three, one ejecting a sangha,
pli-tv-kd9:2.1.6: two ejecting one, two ejecting two, two ejecting three, two ejecting a sangha,
pli-tv-kd9:2.1.8: three ejecting two, three ejecting three, three ejecting a sangha,
pli-tv-kd9:2.2.1: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-kd9:2.2.2: “How can the monks at Campā do such kinds of legal procedures?”
pli-tv-kd9:2.2.4: They told the Buddha. He had the Sangha assembled and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-kd9:2.2.5: “Is it true, monks, that the monks at Campā do such kinds of procedures?”
pli-tv-kd9:2.2.10: It’s not suitable for those foolish men, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of an ascetic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:2.2.11: How can they do such kinds of legal procedures?
pli-tv-kd9:2.2.14: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …” …
pli-tv-kd9:2.2.16: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.1: “Illegitimate legal procedures done by a divided assembly are invalid and not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.2: Illegitimate legal procedures done unanimously are invalid and not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.3: Legitimate legal procedures done by a divided assembly are invalid and not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.4: Legitimate-like legal procedures done by a divided assembly are invalid and not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.5: Legitimate-like legal procedures done unanimously are invalid and not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.6: One person ejecting another is invalid and not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.7: One ejecting two is invalid and not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.8: One ejecting three is invalid and not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.9: One ejecting a sangha is invalid and not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.10: Two ejecting one is invalid and not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.11: Two ejecting two is invalid and not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.12: Two ejecting three is invalid and not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.13: Two ejecting a sangha is invalid and not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.14: Three ejecting one is invalid and not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.15: Three ejecting two is invalid and not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.16: Three ejecting three is invalid and not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.17: Three ejecting a sangha is invalid and not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.18: A sangha ejecting a sangha is invalid and not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:2.4.1: There are these four kinds of legal procedure:
pli-tv-kd9:2.4.2: an illegitimate legal procedure done by a divided assembly, an illegitimate legal procedure done unanimously, a legitimate legal procedure done by a divided assembly, and a legitimate legal procedure done unanimously.
pli-tv-kd9:2.4.3: The illegitimate legal procedure done by a divided assembly is reversible and unfit to stand, because it is illegitimate and the assembly is divided.
pli-tv-kd9:2.4.4: You should not do such procedures; I haven’t allowed such procedures.
pli-tv-kd9:2.4.5: The illegitimate legal procedure done unanimously is reversible and unfit to stand, because it is illegitimate.
pli-tv-kd9:2.4.6: You should not do such procedures; I haven’t allowed such procedures.
pli-tv-kd9:2.4.7: The legitimate legal procedure done by a divided assembly is reversible and unfit to stand, because the assembly is divided.
pli-tv-kd9:2.4.8: You should not do such procedures; I haven’t allowed such procedures.
pli-tv-kd9:2.4.9: The legitimate legal procedure done by a unanimous assembly is irreversible and fit to stand, because it is legitimate and the assembly is unanimous.
pli-tv-kd9:2.4.10: You should do such procedures; I have allowed such procedures.
pli-tv-kd9:2.4.11: Therefore, monks, you should train yourselves like this: ‘We will do legal procedures that are legitimate and unanimous.’”
pli-tv-kd9:2.4.13: Discussion of legal procedures deficient in motion, etc.
pli-tv-kd9:3.1.1: At that time the monks from the group of six did legal procedures such as these:
pli-tv-kd9:3.1.2: illegitimate procedures done by a divided assembly; illegitimate procedures done unanimously;
pli-tv-kd9:3.1.3: legitimate procedures done by a divided assembly; legitimate-like procedures done by a divided assembly; legitimate-like procedures done unanimously;
pli-tv-kd9:3.1.4: procedures deficient in motion but complete in announcement; procedures deficient in announcement but complete in motion; procedures deficient in both motion and announcement;
pli-tv-kd9:3.1.5: procedures not done according to the Teaching; procedures not done according to the Monastic Law; procedures not done according to the Teacher’s instructions;
pli-tv-kd9:3.1.6: procedures that had been objected to, that were illegitimate, reversible, and unfit to stand.
pli-tv-kd9:3.1.7: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-kd9:3.1.8: “How can the monks from the group of six do such kinds of legal procedures?”
pli-tv-kd9:3.1.14: They told the Buddha. He had the Sangha assembled and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-kd9:3.1.15: “Is it true, monks, that the monks from the group of six do such kinds of procedures?”
pli-tv-kd9:3.1.20: and after rebuking them … he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-kd9:3.2.1: “Illegitimate legal procedures done by a divided assembly are invalid and not to be done
pli-tv-kd9:3.2.2: Illegitimate legal procedures done unanimously are invalid and not to be done
pli-tv-kd9:3.2.3: Legitimate legal procedures done by a divided assembly are invalid and not to be done
pli-tv-kd9:3.2.4: Legitimate-like legal procedures done by a divided assembly are invalid and not to be done
pli-tv-kd9:3.2.5: Legitimate-like legal procedures done unanimously are invalid and not to be done
pli-tv-kd9:3.2.6: Legal procedures deficient in motion but complete in announcement are invalid and not to be done
pli-tv-kd9:3.2.7: Legal procedures deficient in announcement but complete in motion are invalid and not to be done
pli-tv-kd9:3.2.8: Legal procedures deficient in both motion and announcement are invalid and not to be done
pli-tv-kd9:3.2.9: Legal procedures not done according to the Teaching are invalid and not to be done
pli-tv-kd9:3.2.10: Legal procedures not done according to the Monastic Law are invalid and not to be done
pli-tv-kd9:3.2.11: Legal procedures not done according to the Teacher’s instructions are invalid and not to be done
pli-tv-kd9:3.2.12: Legal procedures that have been objected to, that are illegitimate, reversible, and unfit to stand are invalid and not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:3.3.1: “Monks, there are these six kinds of legal procedure:
pli-tv-kd9:3.3.2: illegitimate legal procedures, legal procedures done by a divided assembly, legal procedures done unanimously, legitimate-like legal procedures done by a divided assembly, legitimate-like legal procedures done unanimously, legitimate legal procedures done unanimously.
pli-tv-kd9:3.3.3: And what is an illegitimate legal procedure?
pli-tv-kd9:3.3.4: For a procedure that requires one motion and one announcement, if they do a procedure with one motion but no announcement, it is an illegitimate legal procedure.
pli-tv-kd9:3.3.5: For a procedure that requires one motion and one announcement, if they do a procedure with two motions but no announcement, it is an illegitimate legal procedure.
pli-tv-kd9:3.3.6: For a procedure that requires one motion and one announcement, if they do a procedure with one announcement but no motion, it is an illegitimate legal procedure.
pli-tv-kd9:3.3.7: For a procedure that requires one motion and one announcement, if they do a procedure with two announcements but no motion, it is an illegitimate legal procedure.
pli-tv-kd9:3.4.1: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if they do a procedure with one motion but no announcement,
pli-tv-kd9:3.4.2: it is an illegitimate legal procedure.
pli-tv-kd9:3.4.3: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if they do a procedure with two motions but no announcement, it is an illegitimate legal procedure.
pli-tv-kd9:3.4.4: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if they do a procedure with three motions but no announcement, it is an illegitimate legal procedure.
pli-tv-kd9:3.4.5: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if they do a procedure with four motions but no announcement, it is an illegitimate legal procedure.
pli-tv-kd9:3.4.6: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if they do a procedure with one announcement but no motion, it is an illegitimate legal procedure.
pli-tv-kd9:3.4.7: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if they do a procedure with two announcements but no motion, it is an illegitimate legal procedure.
pli-tv-kd9:3.4.8: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if they do a procedure with three announcements but no motion, it is an illegitimate legal procedure.
pli-tv-kd9:3.4.9: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if they do a procedure with four announcements but no motion, it is an illegitimate legal procedure.
pli-tv-kd9:3.5.1: “And what is a legal procedure done by a divided assembly?
pli-tv-kd9:3.5.2: For a procedure that requires one motion and one announcement, if the monks who should be present haven’t all arrived or the consent hasn’t been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent or someone present objects to the decision, it is a legal procedure done by a divided assembly.
pli-tv-kd9:3.5.3: For a procedure that requires one motion and one announcement, if the monks who should be present have arrived but the consent hasn’t been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent or someone present objects to the decision, it is a legal procedure done by a divided assembly.
pli-tv-kd9:3.5.4: For a procedure that requires one motion and one announcement, if the monks who should be present have arrived and the consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent but someone present objects to the decision, it is a legal procedure done by a divided assembly.
pli-tv-kd9:3.5.5: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if the monks who should be present haven’t all arrived or the consent hasn’t been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent or someone present objects to the decision, it is a legal procedure done by a divided assembly.
pli-tv-kd9:3.5.6: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if the monks who should be present have arrived but the consent hasn’t been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent or someone present objects to the decision, it is a legal procedure done by a divided assembly.
pli-tv-kd9:3.5.7: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if the monks who should be present have arrived and the consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent but someone present objects to the decision, it is a legal procedure done by a divided assembly.
pli-tv-kd9:3.6.1: “And what is a legal procedure done unanimously?
pli-tv-kd9:3.6.2: For a procedure that requires one motion and one announcement, if the monks who should be present have arrived and the consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent and no-one present objects to the decision, it is a legal procedure done unanimously.
pli-tv-kd9:3.6.3: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if the monks who should be present have arrived and the consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent and no-one present objects to the decision, it is a legal procedure done unanimously.
pli-tv-kd9:3.7.1: “And what is a legitimate-like legal procedure done by a divided assembly?
pli-tv-kd9:3.7.2: For a procedure that requires one motion and one announcement, if they do the announcement first and the motion afterwards, and if the monks who should be present haven’t all arrived or the consent hasn’t been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent or someone present objects to the decision, it is a legitimate-like legal procedure done by a divided assembly.
pli-tv-kd9:3.7.3: For a procedure that requires one motion and one announcement, if they do the announcement first and the motion afterwards, and if the monks who should be present have arrived but the consent hasn’t been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent or someone present objects to the decision, it is a legitimate-like legal procedure done by a divided assembly.
pli-tv-kd9:3.7.4: For a procedure that requires one motion and one announcement, if they do the announcement first and the motion afterwards, and if the monks who should be present have arrived and the consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent but someone present objects to the decision, it is a legitimate-like legal procedure done by a divided assembly.
pli-tv-kd9:3.7.5: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if they do the announcements first and the motion afterwards, and if the monks who should be present haven’t all arrived or the consent hasn’t been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent or someone present objects to the decision, it is a legitimate-like legal procedure done by a divided assembly.
pli-tv-kd9:3.7.6: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if they do the announcements first and the motion afterwards, and if the monks who should be present have arrived but the consent hasn’t been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent or someone present objects to the decision, it is a legitimate-like legal procedure done by a divided assembly.
pli-tv-kd9:3.7.7: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if they do the announcements first and the motion afterwards, and if the monks who should be present have arrived and the consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent but someone present objects to the decision, it is a legitimate-like legal procedure done by a divided assembly.
pli-tv-kd9:3.8.1: “And what is a legitimate-like legal procedure done unanimously?
pli-tv-kd9:3.8.2: For a procedure that requires one motion and one announcement, if they do the announcement first and the motion afterwards, and the monks who should be present have arrived and the consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent and no-one present objects to the decision, it is a legitimate-like legal procedure done unanimously.
pli-tv-kd9:3.8.3: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if they do the announcements first and the motion afterwards, and the monks who should be present have arrived and the consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent and no-one present objects to the decision, it is a legitimate-like legal procedure done unanimously.
pli-tv-kd9:3.9.1: “And what is a legitimate legal procedure done unanimously?
pli-tv-kd9:3.9.2: For a procedure that requires one motion and one announcement, if they do the motion first and the announcement afterwards, and if the monks who should be present have arrived and the consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent and no-one present objects to the decision, it is a legitimate legal procedure done unanimously.
pli-tv-kd9:3.9.3: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if they do the motion first and the announcements afterwards, and if the monks who should be present have arrived and the consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent and no-one present objects to the decision, it is a legitimate legal procedure done unanimously.”
pli-tv-kd9:3.9.5: Discussion of what can be done by a group of four, etc.
pli-tv-kd9:4.1.2: a sangha of monks consisting of a group of four, a sangha of monks consisting of a group of five, a sangha of monks consisting of a group of ten, a sangha of monks consisting of a group of twenty, a sangha of monks consisting of a group of more than twenty.
pli-tv-kd9:4.1.3: A sangha of monks consisting of a group of four—unanimous, acting legitimately—is able to do all legal procedures except three:
pli-tv-kd9:4.1.5: A sangha of monks consisting of a group of five—unanimous, acting legitimately—is able to do all legal procedures except two:
pli-tv-kd9:4.1.6: ordination in the middle countries and rehabilitation.
pli-tv-kd9:4.1.7: A sangha of monks consisting of a group of ten—unanimous, acting legitimately—is able to do all legal procedures except one:
pli-tv-kd9:4.1.9: A sangha of monks consisting of a group of twenty—unanimous, acting legitimately—is able to do all legal procedures.
pli-tv-kd9:4.1.10: A sangha of monks consisting of a group of more than twenty—unanimous, acting legitimately—is able to do all legal procedures.
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.1: “If a legal procedure that requires a group of four is done with a nun as the fourth member,
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.2: it is invalid and not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.3: If a legal procedure that requires a group of four is done with a trainee nun as the fourth member,
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.4: it is invalid and not to be done. …
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.5: done with a novice monk as the fourth member,
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.6: it is invalid and not to be done. …
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.7: done with a novice nun as the fourth member,
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.8: it is invalid and not to be done. …
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.9: done with one who has renounced the training as the fourth member,
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.10: it is invalid and not to be done. …
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.11: done with one who has committed the worst kind of offense as the fourth member,
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.12: it is invalid and not to be done. …
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.13: done with one who has been ejected for not recognizing an offense as the fourth member,
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.14: it is invalid and not to be done. …
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.15: done with one who has been ejected for not making amends for an offense as the fourth member,
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.16: it is invalid and not to be done. …
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.17: done with one who has been ejected for not giving up a bad view as the fourth member,
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.18: it is invalid and not to be done. …
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.19: done with a eunuch as the fourth member,
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.20: it is invalid and not to be done. …
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.21: done with one living in the community by theft as the fourth member,
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.22: it is invalid and not to be done. …
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.23: done with one who has previously left to join the ascetics of another sect as the fourth member,
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.24: it is invalid and not to be done. …
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.25: done with an animal as the fourth member,
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.26: it is invalid and not to be done. …
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.27: done with a matricide as the fourth member,
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.28: it is invalid and not to be done. …
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.29: done with a patricide as the fourth member,
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.30: it is invalid and not to be done. …
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.31: done with a murderer of a perfected one as the fourth member,
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.32: it is invalid and not to be done. …
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.33: done with one who has raped a nun as the fourth member,
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.34: it is invalid and not to be done. …
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.35: done with one who has caused a schism in the Sangha as the fourth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.6.2: Discussion of the one on probation, etc.
pli-tv-kd9:4.6.3: “If a group with one on probation as the fourth member gives probation, sends back to the beginning, or gives the trial period, or a group with one on probation as the twentieth member rehabilitates,
pli-tv-kd9:4.6.4: it is invalid and not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:4.6.5: If a group with one deserving to be sent back to the beginning as the fourth member gives probation, sends back to the beginning, or gives the trial period, or a group with one deserving to be sent back to the beginning as the twentieth member rehabilitates,
pli-tv-kd9:4.6.6: it is invalid and not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:4.6.7: If a group with one deserving the trial period as the fourth member gives probation, sends back to the beginning, or gives the trial period, or a group with one deserving a trial period as the twentieth member rehabilitates,
pli-tv-kd9:4.6.8: it is invalid and not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:4.6.9: If a group with one undertaking the trial period as the fourth member gives probation, sends back to the beginning, or gives the trial period, or a group with one undertaking a trial period as the twentieth member rehabilitates,
pli-tv-kd9:4.6.10: it is invalid and not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:4.6.11: If a group with one deserving rehabilitation as the fourth member gives probation, sends back to the beginning, or gives the trial period, or a group with one deserving rehabilitation as the twentieth member rehabilitates,
pli-tv-kd9:4.6.12: it is invalid and not to be done.
pli-tv-kd9:4.7.1: “In the midst of the Sangha, the objections of some are valid, not the objections of others.
pli-tv-kd9:4.7.2: Whose objections are invalid in the midst of the Sangha?
pli-tv-kd9:4.7.3: In the midst of the Sangha, the objection of a nun is invalid.
pli-tv-kd9:4.7.7: of one who has renounced the training …
pli-tv-kd9:4.7.8: of one who has committed the worst kind of offense …
pli-tv-kd9:4.7.11: of one who is overwhelmed by pain …
pli-tv-kd9:4.7.12: of one who has been ejected for not recognizing an offense …
pli-tv-kd9:4.7.13: of one who has been ejected for not making amends for an offense …
pli-tv-kd9:4.7.14: of one who has been ejected for not giving up a bad view …
pli-tv-kd9:4.7.16: of one living in the community by theft …
pli-tv-kd9:4.7.17: of one who has previously left to join the ascetics of another sect …
pli-tv-kd9:4.7.21: of a murderer of a perfected one …
pli-tv-kd9:4.7.22: of one who has raped a nun …
pli-tv-kd9:4.7.23: of one who has caused a schism in the Sangha …
pli-tv-kd9:4.7.24: of one who has caused the Buddha to bleed …
pli-tv-kd9:4.7.26: of one who belongs to a different community …
pli-tv-kd9:4.7.27: of one who is outside the boundary …
pli-tv-kd9:4.7.28: of one floating in the air by supernormal power …
pli-tv-kd9:4.7.29: In the midst of the Sangha, the objection of one who is subject to the legal procedure is invalid.
pli-tv-kd9:4.8.1: Whose objections are valid in the midst of the Sangha?
pli-tv-kd9:4.8.2: In the midst of the Sangha, the objection of an regular monk, who belongs to the same community and is staying within the same boundary, even if only declared to a monk sitting next to him, is valid.”
pli-tv-kd9:4.8.4: Discussion of the two kinds of sending away, etc.
pli-tv-kd9:4.9.1: “There are two kinds of sending away.
pli-tv-kd9:4.9.2: If the Sangha sends away those who don’t have the attributes needed for being sent away,
pli-tv-kd9:4.9.3: the sending away of some succeeds, while the sending away of others fails.
pli-tv-kd9:4.9.4: Who are those whose sending away fails?
pli-tv-kd9:4.9.5: Those who are pure, without offenses.
pli-tv-kd9:4.9.7: Who are those whose sending away succeeds?
pli-tv-kd9:4.9.8: Those who are ignorant, incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether they have committed an offense, constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
pli-tv-kd9:4.10.2: If the Sangha admits those who don’t have the attributes needed for being admitted, the admittance of some succeeds, while the admittance of others fails.
pli-tv-kd9:4.10.3: Who are those whose admittance fails?
pli-tv-kd9:4.10.4: A eunuch doesn’t have the attributes needed for being admitted, and if the Sangha admits him, his admittance fails.
pli-tv-kd9:4.10.5: One living in the community by theft doesn’t have the attributes needed for being admitted, and if the Sangha admits him, his admittance fails.
pli-tv-kd9:4.10.6: One who has previously left to join the ascetics of another sect …
pli-tv-kd9:4.10.10: A murderer of a perfected one …
pli-tv-kd9:4.10.11: One who has raped a nun …
pli-tv-kd9:4.10.12: One who has caused a schism in the Sangha …
pli-tv-kd9:4.10.13: One who has caused the Buddha to bleed …
pli-tv-kd9:4.10.14: An intersex doesn’t have the attributes needed for being admitted, and if the Sangha admits him, his admittance fails.
pli-tv-kd9:4.11.1: Who are those whose admittance succeeds?
pli-tv-kd9:4.11.2: One without a hand doesn’t have the attributes needed for being admitted, but if the Sangha admits him, his admittance succeeds.
pli-tv-kd9:4.11.4: One without a hand and a foot …
pli-tv-kd9:4.11.7: One without an ear and nose …
pli-tv-kd9:4.11.8: One without a finger or a toe …
pli-tv-kd9:4.11.33: A blind, mute, and deaf person doesn’t have the attributes needed for being admitted, but if the Sangha admits him, his admittance succeeds.”
pli-tv-kd9:4.11.36: The first section for recitation on the village of Vāsabha is finished.
pli-tv-kd9:4.11.37: Discussion of illegitimate legal procedures, etc.
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.1: “It may be that a monk doesn’t have any offense he needs to recognize,
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.2: yet the Sangha, several monks, or an individual monk accuses him, saying:
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.3: ‘You have committed an offense; do you recognize it?’
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.5: ‘I haven’t committed any offense that I should recognize,’
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.6: yet the Sangha ejects him for not recognizing an offense,
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.7: then the legal procedure is illegitimate.
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.8: It may be that a monk doesn’t have any offense he needs to make amends for,
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.9: yet the Sangha, several monks, or an individual monk accuses him, saying:
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.10: ‘You have committed an offense; make amends for it.’
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.12: ‘I haven’t committed any offense that I should make amends for,’
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.13: yet the Sangha ejects him for not making amends for an offense,
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.14: then the legal procedure is illegitimate.
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.15: It may be that a monk doesn’t have any bad view he needs to give up,
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.16: yet the Sangha, several monks, or an individual monk accuses him, saying:
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.17: ‘You have a bad view that you need to give up.’
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.19: ‘I don’t have any bad view that I should give up,’
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.20: yet the Sangha ejects him for not giving up a bad view,
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.21: then the legal procedure is illegitimate.
pli-tv-kd9:5.2.1: It may be that a monk doesn’t have any offense he needs to recognize, nor any he needs to make amends for,
pli-tv-kd9:5.2.2: yet the Sangha, several monks, or an individual monk accuses him, saying:
pli-tv-kd9:5.2.3: ‘You have committed an offense; do you recognize it?
pli-tv-kd9:5.2.6: ‘I haven’t committed any offense that I should recognize,
pli-tv-kd9:5.2.7: nor any I should make amends for,’
pli-tv-kd9:5.2.8: yet the Sangha ejects him for not recognizing an offense or for not making amends for it,
pli-tv-kd9:5.2.9: then the legal procedure is illegitimate.
pli-tv-kd9:5.3.1: It may be that a monk doesn’t have any offense he needs to recognize, nor any bad view he needs to give up,
pli-tv-kd9:5.3.2: yet the Sangha, several monks, or an individual monk accuses him, saying:
pli-tv-kd9:5.3.3: ‘You have committed an offense; do you recognize it?
pli-tv-kd9:5.3.4: And you have a bad view that you need to give up.’
pli-tv-kd9:5.3.6: ‘I haven’t committed any offense that I should recognize,
pli-tv-kd9:5.3.7: nor do I have any bad view that I should give up,’
pli-tv-kd9:5.3.8: yet the Sangha ejects him for not recognizing an offense or for not giving up a bad view,
pli-tv-kd9:5.3.9: then the legal procedure is illegitimate.
pli-tv-kd9:5.4.1: It may be that a monk doesn’t have any offense he needs to make amends for, nor any bad view he needs to give up,
pli-tv-kd9:5.4.2: yet the Sangha, several monks, or an individual monk accuses him, saying:
pli-tv-kd9:5.4.3: ‘You have committed an offense; make amends for it.
pli-tv-kd9:5.4.4: And you have a bad view that you need to give up.’
pli-tv-kd9:5.4.6: ‘I haven’t committed any offense that I should make amends for,
pli-tv-kd9:5.4.7: nor do I have any bad view that I should give up,’
pli-tv-kd9:5.4.8: yet the Sangha ejects him for not making amends for an offense or for not giving up a bad view,
pli-tv-kd9:5.4.9: then the legal procedure is illegitimate.
pli-tv-kd9:5.5.1: It may be that a monk doesn’t have any offense he needs to recognize, nor any offense he needs to make amends for, nor any bad view he needs to give up,
pli-tv-kd9:5.5.2: yet the Sangha, several monks, or an individual monk accuses him, saying:
pli-tv-kd9:5.5.3: ‘You have committed an offense; do you recognize it?
pli-tv-kd9:5.5.5: And you have a bad view that you need to give up.’
pli-tv-kd9:5.5.7: ‘I haven’t committed any offense that I should recognize,
pli-tv-kd9:5.5.8: nor any I should make amends for,
pli-tv-kd9:5.5.9: nor do I have any bad view that I should give up,’
pli-tv-kd9:5.5.10: yet the Sangha ejects him for not recognizing an offense, for not making amends for an offense, or for not giving up a bad view,
pli-tv-kd9:5.5.11: then the legal procedure is illegitimate.
pli-tv-kd9:5.6.1: “It may be that a monk does have an offense he needs to recognize,
pli-tv-kd9:5.6.3: and the Sangha, several monks, or an individual monk accuses him, saying:
pli-tv-kd9:5.6.4: ‘You have committed an offense; do you recognize it?’
pli-tv-kd9:5.6.7: yet the Sangha ejects him for not recognizing an offense,
pli-tv-kd9:5.6.8: then the legal procedure is illegitimate.
pli-tv-kd9:5.6.9: It may be that a monk does have an offense he needs to make amends for,
pli-tv-kd9:5.6.10: and the Sangha, several monks, or an individual monk accuses him, saying:
pli-tv-kd9:5.6.11: ‘You have committed an offense; make amends for it.’
pli-tv-kd9:5.6.14: yet the Sangha ejects him for not making amends for an offense,
pli-tv-kd9:5.6.15: then the legal procedure is illegitimate.
pli-tv-kd9:5.6.16: It may be that a monk does have a bad view he needs to give up,
pli-tv-kd9:5.6.17: and the Sangha, several monks, or an individual monk accuses him, saying:
pli-tv-kd9:5.6.19: that you need to give up.’
pli-tv-kd9:5.6.22: yet the Sangha ejects him for not giving up a bad view,
pli-tv-kd9:5.6.23: then the legal procedure is illegitimate.
pli-tv-kd9:5.7.1: It may be that a monk does have an offense he needs to recognize and one that he needs to make amends for …
pli-tv-kd9:5.7.2: an offense he needs to recognize and a bad view he needs to give up …
pli-tv-kd9:5.7.3: an offense he needs to make amends for and a bad view he needs to give up …
pli-tv-kd9:5.7.4: an offense he needs to recognize, an offense he needs to make amends for, and a bad view he needs to give up,
pli-tv-kd9:5.7.5: and the Sangha, several monks, or an individual monk accuses him, saying:
pli-tv-kd9:5.7.6: ‘You have committed an offense; do you recognize it?
pli-tv-kd9:5.7.8: And you have a bad view that you need to give up.’
pli-tv-kd9:5.7.10: ‘I recognize it, I’ll make amends for it, and I’ll give up that view,’
pli-tv-kd9:5.7.11: yet the Sangha ejects him for not recognizing an offense, for not making amends for an offense, or for not giving up a bad view,
pli-tv-kd9:5.7.12: then the legal procedure is illegitimate.
pli-tv-kd9:5.8.1: “It may be that a monk does have an offense he needs to recognize,
pli-tv-kd9:5.8.2: and the Sangha, several monks, or an individual monk accuses him, saying:
pli-tv-kd9:5.8.3: ‘You have committed an offense; do you recognize it?’
pli-tv-kd9:5.8.5: ‘I haven’t committed any offense that I should recognize,’
pli-tv-kd9:5.8.6: and the Sangha ejects him for not recognizing an offense,
pli-tv-kd9:5.8.7: then the legal procedure is legitimate.
pli-tv-kd9:5.8.8: It may be that a monk does have an offense he needs to make amends for,
pli-tv-kd9:5.8.9: and the Sangha, several monks, or an individual monk accuses him, saying:
pli-tv-kd9:5.8.10: ‘You have committed an offense; make amends for it.’
pli-tv-kd9:5.8.12: ‘I haven’t committed any offense that I should make amends for,’
pli-tv-kd9:5.8.13: and the Sangha ejects him for not making amends for an offense,
pli-tv-kd9:5.8.14: then the legal procedure is legitimate.
pli-tv-kd9:5.8.15: It may be that a monk does have a bad view he needs to give up,
pli-tv-kd9:5.8.16: and the Sangha, several monks, or an individual monk accuses him, saying:
pli-tv-kd9:5.8.17: ‘You have a bad view that you need to give up.’
pli-tv-kd9:5.8.19: ‘I don’t have any bad view that I should give up,’
pli-tv-kd9:5.8.20: and the Sangha ejects him for not giving up a bad view,
pli-tv-kd9:5.8.21: then the legal procedure is legitimate.
pli-tv-kd9:5.9.1: It may be that a monk does have an offense he needs to recognize and one that he needs to make amends for …
pli-tv-kd9:5.9.2: an offense he needs to recognize and a bad view he needs to give up …
pli-tv-kd9:5.9.3: an offense he needs to make amends for and a bad view he needs to give up …
pli-tv-kd9:5.9.4: an offense he needs to recognize, an offense he needs to make amends for, and a bad view he needs to give up,
pli-tv-kd9:5.9.5: and the Sangha, several monks, or an individual monk accuses him, saying:
pli-tv-kd9:5.9.6: ‘You have committed an offense; do you recognize it?
pli-tv-kd9:5.9.8: And you have a bad view that you need to give up.’
pli-tv-kd9:5.9.10: ‘I haven’t committed any offense that I should recognize,
pli-tv-kd9:5.9.11: nor any I should make amends for,
pli-tv-kd9:5.9.12: nor do I have any bad view that I should give up,’
pli-tv-kd9:5.9.13: and the Sangha ejects him for not recognizing an offense, for not making amends for an offense, or for not giving up a bad view,
pli-tv-kd9:5.9.14: then the legal procedure is legitimate.”
pli-tv-kd9:6.1.1: On one occasion Venerable Upāli went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,
pli-tv-kd9:6.1.3: “If, Venerable Sir, a unanimous Sangha doesn’t do a legal procedure face-to-face that should be done face-to-face, is that a legitimate procedure, a procedure in accordance with the Monastic Law?”
pli-tv-kd9:6.1.4: “That legal procedure, Upāli, is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law.”

pli-tv-kd9:6.9.55: Discussion of the legal procedure of condemnation
pli-tv-kd9:7.1.1: “It may be, monks, that a monk is quarrelsome and disputatious, one who creates legal issues in the Sangha.
pli-tv-kd9:7.1.3: ‘This monk is quarrelsome and disputatious, one who creates legal issues in the Sangha.
pli-tv-kd9:7.1.4: Well then, let’s do a legal procedure of condemnation against him.’
pli-tv-kd9:7.1.5: They do a procedure of condemnation against him—
pli-tv-kd9:7.1.6: illegitimately and with a divided assembly.
pli-tv-kd9:7.1.7: He then goes to another monastery.
pli-tv-kd9:7.1.9: ‘The Sangha did a legal procedure of condemnation against this monk—illegitimately and with a divided assembly.
pli-tv-kd9:7.1.10: Well then, let’s do a procedure of condemnation against him.’
pli-tv-kd9:7.1.11: They do a procedure of condemnation against him—
pli-tv-kd9:7.1.13: He then goes to yet another monastery.
pli-tv-kd9:7.1.15: ‘The Sangha did a legal procedure of condemnation against this monk—illegitimately but unanimous.
pli-tv-kd9:7.1.16: Well then, let’s do a procedure of condemnation against him.’
pli-tv-kd9:7.1.17: They do a procedure of condemnation against him—
pli-tv-kd9:7.1.18: legitimately but with a divided assembly.
pli-tv-kd9:7.1.19: He then goes to yet another monastery.
pli-tv-kd9:7.1.21: ‘The Sangha did a legal procedure of condemnation against this monk—legitimately but with a divided assembly.
pli-tv-kd9:7.1.22: Well then, let’s do a procedure of condemnation against him.’
pli-tv-kd9:7.1.23: They do a procedure of condemnation against him—
pli-tv-kd9:7.1.24: in a legitimate-like way and with a divided assembly.
pli-tv-kd9:7.1.25: He then goes to yet another monastery.
pli-tv-kd9:7.1.27: ‘The Sangha did a legal procedure of condemnation against this monk—in a legitimate-like way and with a divided assembly.
pli-tv-kd9:7.1.28: Well then, let’s do a procedure of condemnation against him.’
pli-tv-kd9:7.1.29: They do a procedure of condemnation against him—
pli-tv-kd9:7.1.30: in a legitimate-like way but unanimous.
